title: Pakistan Snatch Thriller Win After Zimbabwe ightback
byline: Pakistan survived a major scare to chase down 148 and beat Zimbabwe by five wickets in the opening match of the tri-series, thanks to Usman Khan’s unbeaten 37 and Mohammad Nawaz’s late heroics.

title: Landslide derails upcountry train, Services limited to Nanu Oya
byline: Train services on the Upcountry line have been limited to operate only between Colombo Fort and Nanu Oya after a landslide caused the night mail train from Badulla to derail at both Ohiya and Idalgashinna Railway Stations last evening.

title: School Development Officers will be made teachers after court verdict: PM
byline: Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education Minister and Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya said future teacher appointments will be made only after court proceedings conclude and a verdict is delivered, ensuring the process aligns with the Teachers’ Service Constitution.

title: A snake causes commotion in Speaker’s office
byline: A tense situation arose yesterday morning (18) at the Parliamentary office of Speaker Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne after a snake was spotted inside the premises.

title: Deputy Minister Hemachandra to attend 4th EU-Indo Pacific forum in Brussels
byline: Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs and Foreign Employment, Arun Hemachandra, will undertake an official visit to Brussels, Belgium, from 19 to 22 November 2025 to attend the 4th EU-Indo Pacific Ministerial Forum.

title: Migrant Workers’ Fair to open tomorrow at Diyatha Uyana
byline: The Sri Lanka Foreign Employment Bureau (SLBFE) will host the Migrant Workers’ Fair tomorrow (20) at the Diyatha Uyana premises in Battaramulla, featuring a wide range of products created by returning migrant workers.

title: No talks yet on recall of Thai elephants: Minister
byline: The Sri Lankan and Thai governments have not held any discussions regarding the potential recall of two elephants gifted to Sri Lanka, Environment Minister Dr. Dhammika Prasad said yesterday, assuring that the animals are in good health and have not caused any harm.

title: Kiwi solo traveller urges not to judge Sri Lanka by one man
byline: A 24-year-old Kiwi woman travelling solo across South East Asia says she was left “on edge” after a man in Sri Lanka sexually harassed her and lewdly exposed himself while trailing her tuk-tuk.

title: Upcountry train services limited
byline: Train operations on the Upcountry line have been restricted following a landslide between Ohiya and Idalgashinna Railway Stations. Services from Colombo are now running only up to Nanu Oya, while trains departing from Badulla are limited to Bandrawela.

title: SriLankan Airlines flights diverted to Mattala due to low visibility at BIA
byline: Three SriLankan Airlines flights returning from Mumbai, Riyadh, and Guangzhou were safely diverted to Mattala Rajapaksa International Airport (MRIA) this morning due to low visibility caused by heavy mist over the Katunayake area.

title: “Come and face the law” — President tells Basil
byline: With uncertainty swirling over the return of Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) founder Basil Rajapaksa for a court case, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake yesterday (18) asked the former Finance Minister to “come and face the law.”

title: Committee appointed to probe MP Dayasiri Jayasekera’s conduct
byline: A committee headed by Deputy Speaker Rizvie Salih and comprising MPs Upali Pannilage and Ranjith Madduma Bandara has been appointed to look into the conduct of MP Dayasiri Jayasekera, Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne announced in Parliament today.

title: Pakistan Snatch Thriller Win After Zimbabwe Fightback
byline: Pakistan survived a major scare to chase down 148 and beat Zimbabwe by five wickets in the opening match of the tri-series, thanks to Usman Khan’s unbeaten 37 and Mohammad Nawaz’s late heroics.

title: Garden Painting Party to brighten Malabe this Sunday
byline: Art enthusiasts and those seeking a relaxing, creative escape are invited to the Garden Painting Party this Sunday at the Malabe Island Tea & Ceylon Coffee Club.

title: Namal Rajapaksa resigns from Committee on Parliamentary Business
byline: Speaker Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne announced today that MP D.V. Chanaka has been nominated to the Committee on Parliamentary Business.

title: Thumpane Pradeshiya Sabha launches probe into monkey detention incident
byline: The Thumpane Pradeshiya Sabha has requested an investigation following reports of the violent detention of a group of monkeys at its premises in Kandy.

title: No more jeeps allowed in Yala, Wildlife Department warns
byline: The Wildlife Department has rejected requests to add more safari jeeps to the Yala National Park fleet, citing threats to wildlife due to overcrowding.

title: Ayurvedic drug production hit by shortage of key medicinal plants
byline: The Sri Lanka Ayurvedic Pharmaceuticals Corporation is facing a major production crisis due to a severe shortage of essential medicinal plants required for local Ayurvedic drug manufacturing.

title: SC grants leave to proceed with BASL’s FR petition on university ragging
byline: The Supreme Court yesterday (18) granted leave to proceed with two Fundamental Rights petitions, including one filed by the Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL), in relation to the tragic ragging and subsequent suicide of 23-year-old Charith Dilshan Dayananda, a second-year student of the Faculty of Technology at the Sabaragamuwa University of Sri Lanka.

title: Namal dismisses degree allegations, vows rally response
byline: National Organizer of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Namal Rajapaksa today rejected claims circulating about his academic qualifications, asserting that all “slanders and insults” will be addressed at the SLPP rally in Nugegoda on the 21st.

title: Anuradhapura Sri Maha Bodhi Chief custodian arrested with wild animal meat
byline: A special raid conducted by the Wildlife Department in Viharapalugama, Anuradhapura, led to the seizure of a large stock of wild animal meat, live tortoises and 14 tortoise eggs and the arrest of a prominent multi-millionaire custodian.

title: Commercial Bank first to launch Google Pay in Sri Lanka
byline: Commercial Bank of Ceylon PLC is making history as the first bank in the country to collaborate with Google and Visa, a global leader in digital payments, to enable Google Pay for its card holders as part of the Google Wallet launch.

title: Trump praises Cristiano Ronaldo at White House dinner in rare US appearance for soccer great
byline: President Donald Trump praised soccer great Cristiano Ronaldo during a White House dinner to welcome the Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia, Mohammed bin Salman.

title: Two rare bat species found for the first time
byline: Sri Lankan researchers have, for the first time, documented the presence of two rare free-tailed bat species Wroughton’s free-tailed bat (Otomops wroughtoni) and the East Asian free-tailed bat (Tadarida insignis) using advanced acoustic monitoring in tea plantations across the island.

title: 30% of transgender sex workers trapped in drug addiction crisis: TET warns
byline: The Trans Equality Trust (TET) has raised serious concern that between 25% and 30% of transgender sex workers in the country are addicted to drugs, including ice, heroin, marijuana and alcohol.

title: CBSL declares 22 companies and apps as prohibited pyramid schemes
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has officially identified and declared 22 companies and mobile applications as prohibited pyramid schemes under Section 83(C) of the Banking Act No. 30 of 1988, as amended.

title: Profit taking weighs on ASPI: JFP.N debuts with strong gains
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange remained subdued on Tuesday (19th November 2025), with the ASPI closing in negative territory for the fifth consecutive session, recording a modest decline of 21.80 points (-0.09%) to 23,029.86. The S&P SL20 also retreated, falling 14.96 points (-0.23%) to 6,361.58, as volatility persisted and overall market activity remained muted.

title: Namal accuses govt. of double standards over Trincomalee Buddha statue removal
byline: National Organizer of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Namal Rajapaksa today accused the government of maintaining double standards and failing to provide a clear explanation regarding the recent removal of a Buddha statue from a well-known temple in Trincomalee.

title: Govt revises driving licence levy regulations for foreigners
byline: The Transport Ministry introduced new changes to the Motor Traffic Act, Chapter 203, through Gazette No. 2463/04 issued on November 17.

title: ICC U19 Men’s Cricket World Cup schedule announced
byline: The International Cricket Council (ICC) today unveiled the match schedule for the ICC U19 Men’s Cricket World Cup 2026, which will be co-hosted by Zimbabwe and Namibia from 15 January to 6 February 2026.

title: ’President assures us that PC elections will be held’: Rasamanickam
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake assured the Illankai Tamil Arasu Katchi (ITAK) this afternoon that the Provincial Council elections will be held, said MP Shanakiyan Rasamanickam.

title: Probe 90% complete in case against Ranil Wikremesinghe: AG tells court
byline: The Attorney General yesterday informed Fort Magistrate Isuru Neththikumara that investigations into the case filed against former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, over the alleged misuse of Rs. 16.6 million in State funds, will be completed within a month and that steps will thereafter be taken to institute proceedings before a higher court.

title: NPP requests police to facilitate its rally in Tangalle: Opposition MP
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has sought the assistance of the police to facilitate its rally to be held in Tangalle tomorrow, Opposition MP D.V. Chanaka alleged today.

title: UK reaffirms commitment to protect religious freedom in Sri Lanka
byline: The United Kingdom has reiterated its continued support for religious freedom and the protection of the rights of all faith communities in Sri Lanka, Parliamentary Under-Secretary Seema Malhotra told UK Parliament.

title: Fleet of vehicle to be imported includes 700 other essential vehicles: Minister
byline: The fleet of vehicles that the government is planning to import includes 700 other essential vehicles required for the Local Government institutions throughout the country, Trade Minister Wasantha Samarasinghe said today.

title: Writ petition against alleged demolition of section of Trincomalee temple to be heard on December 16
byline: The writ petition filed by the Chief Incumbent of the Sri Sambuddha Jayanthi Bodhiraja Viharaya in Trincomalee, Venerable Kalyanawansa Tissa Thera, seeking an order to prevent the demolition of a section of the temple premises, has been fixed for December 16 by the Court of Appeal.

title: ‘When Media Minister quotes an unknown website, it shows the fear the govt has against us’ - Namal slams govt.
byline: National Organizer of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna and Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa today called on the government to concentrate on fulfilling its long overdue pledges made to the public rather than focusing on spinning lies against the opposition members.

title: Submit list of SJB MPs who reject cabs: Bimal tells Madduma Bandara
byline: Leader of the House, Minister Bimal Rathnayake requested Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) General Secrerty Ranjith Madduma Bandara to submit a letter with the names of the SJB MPs who do not require cab vehicles to be provided by the government.

title: Police warn against false reports on police clearance
byline: The Sri Lanka Police have clarified that reports circulating in the media claiming that a character certificate from the Chairman of the Civil Security Committee is required to obtain a police clearance report are false.

title: China to suspend imports of Japanese seafood amid diplomatic row: Reports
byline: China will again ban all imports of Japanese seafood as a diplomatic dispute between the two countries escalates, Japanese media report.

title: First kiss dates back 21 million years, say scientists
byline: Humans do it, monkeys do it, even polar bears do it. And now researchers have reconstructed the evolutionary origins of kissing.

title: Curacao become smallest nation to qualify for World Cup
byline: The tiny Caribbean island of Curacao has become the smallest nation to ever qualify for the World Cup after drawing with Steve McClaren’s Jamaica.
